oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Kentucky Headhunters Interview by Bob Allen Side One
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of The Kentucky Headhunters being interviewed by Bob Allen.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kentucky Headhunters
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:24) -- Richard Young of the Kentucky Headhunters speaks about putting the band together in 1986. (1:29) -- Richard Young describes writing songs for Acuff/Rose. (2:22) -- Richard Young mentions Greg Martin playing in a band with Doug Phelps. (3:28) -- Richard Young describes the evolution of the Kentucky Headhunters' songwriting. (6:43) -- Richard Young describes the chemistry between Greg Martin and Doug Phelps. (7:54) -- Richard Young describes what makes a band work together. (8:55) -- Bob Allen asks Richard Young about The Kentucky Headhunters' first album. (9:38) -- Richard Young mentions his friend Jonathan Lyle, a man who loaned The Kentucky Headhunters the money to record their first record. (10:50) -- Richard Young describes the Kentucky Headhunters' connections to Nashville's publishers. (12:22) -- Richard Young describes pitching music to a publishing company in Nashville in competition with another group pitching the same day. (16:31) -- Richard Young describes pitching the Kentucky Headhunters to Columbia and Airborne Records. (20:22) -- Richard Young describes signing the Kentucky Headhunters' first record deal. (21:40) -- Richard Young describes the struggles of Polygram Records. (25:50) -- Richard Young describes the main goal of The Kentucky Headhunters. (27:28) -- Bob Allen asks about the Kentucky Headhunters' new album.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: The Kentucky Headhunters (Musical group);
